Wagner Graduate School of Public Service      School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law      School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                                        go                                                    New York University              New York University              Information Technology Services                                                 About ITS                              Get Connected                               Communicate & Collaborate                               Help & Support                                 Computer Security                                Instruction & Research                             Advanced Media Studio                          NYU Classes                          Digital Studio                            Hands-on Computer Classrooms                                 lynda.com                           NYU Print Service                          Remote Instruction                          Research Computing                          NYU Stream                          Video Conferencing                          Web Publishing                                            Locations & Facilities                                                                         Home           //        Instruction & Research                 //         Hands-on Computer Classrooms                                            Hands-on Computer Classrooms                     search the site                                                                        did you know?            To report a technical problem at one of ITS' hands-on Macintosh     computer classrooms, fill out our       Assistance Request Form .       To report a technical problem at one of ITS' hands-on Windows     computer classrooms, fill out this request form or contact the IT Service Desk .                                related pages            Classroom Media Services       ITS Computer Labs                          ITS support hands-on Macintosh and Windows computer classrooms that are available for reservation by instructors for an entire semester or for  occasional class meetings that require in-class computer use by students.    Hands-on speciality Macintosh computer classrooms   These classrooms are located at the ITS Academic Technology Centers , and are available for class meetings with special multimedia requirements.  Each classroom is equipped with Macintosh computers for each student and an advanced instructor station that includes an interactive multimedia projection system.    For details about locations, capacity, training options, and reserving one of these rooms, please see: Hands-on speciality Macintosh computer classrooms in the ServiceLink knowledge base.    Hands-on general purpose hands-on Windows computer classrooms   These classrooms (reserved through NYU Room Scheduling and Assignments or the CAS Office of Academic Affairs) are available for classes that require students to have access to a computer during the session. Each is equipped with a Windows computer for  each student, and most are equipped with an instructor station as well.    For details about locations, capacity, training and equipment options, and reserving one of these rooms, please see: Hands-on general purpose Windows computer classrooms in the ServiceLink knowledge base.    Page last reviewed: October 27, 2014

Hand Division | Orthopaedic Surgery                                 Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Orthopaedic Surgery                                                                                  Home   Patient Care   Research   Education & Training   For Physicians   About Us                                  Home About Us Our Divisions Hand            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                   Hand Division    The Division of Hand Surgery is one of the largest such divisions in the United States, providing comprehensive care for all the many problems that can affect the upper extremities. They include: acute traumatic injuries (fractures and dislocations of the wrist and hand, and lacerations of tendons, nerves and arteries), reconstruction for chronic post-traumatic problems, arthritic conditions of the wrist and hand (osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, gout, etc.), acquired conditions (nerve compressions that most commonly involve carpal tunnel syndrome, and tumors and tumor like masses such as ganglions), congenital deformities, and neuromuscular disorders in children (cerebral palsy) and the elderly (after strokes).   Our board-certified and fellowship-trained hand specialists evaluate and treat thousands of patients each year. The most effective treatment is often non-operative measures including hand therapy and the use of different types of splints fabricated by our Certified Hand Therapists. When surgery is necessary, the latest and most sophisticated techniques are used; over 5,000 operative procedures are performed each year at our five locations .   In 2013, the Department established a Hand Center at NYU Langone’s Tisch Hospital. The Hand Center at NYU Langone Medical Center offers the full spectrum of hand services for patients of all ages.   Read more about the Conditions & Procedures we address, Our Hand Specialists , and Clinical Trials .   Residency and Fellowship Training   Resident and fellowship training is fully integrated across the five hospitals that constitute the Department of Orthopaedic Surgery, under the direction of Martin Posner, MD, Chief of the Division. The other faculty members in charge of training are:   Nader Paksima, DO (Jamaica Hospital)   Anthony Sapienza, MD (Bellevue Hospital)   Steven Green, MD and Susan Scott, MD (VA Hospital)   John T. Capo, MD (Jersey City Medical Center)   Our physicians provide excellent training for the next generation of hand specialists. Read more about Resident and Fellowship Training                                                                 Conditions & Procedures             See a list of conditions addressed and procedures performed within the Hand Division.         More              Hand Specialists             Meet the world-class team of Hand Specialists.         More              Research & Clinical Trials             Learn about Hand Research and Clinical Trials that take place within the Musculoskeletal Research Center.          Smart Classroom Hands-On: SMART Podium                      Tuesday, February 24, 2015 - 11:00am - 12:00pm EST                             Location: Jacobs Academic Building, 475 Six MetroTech Center Brooklyn , New York              Website: http://engineering.nyu.edu/workshop-schedule              Contact: Lexie Bryan fitl@nyu.edu 718-260-4120                              Get some hands-on time with the SMART Podium, an interactive tablet that allows you to create, present, and save digital content in the classroom.   For information on the SMART Podium's features, please view the video Teaching with the SMART Podium Interactive Display before attending this session (NYU login required).   This faculty and staff workshop is offered by the Center for Faculty Innovations in Teaching and Learning (FITL).   Please provide 24 hours notice when planning to attend workshops.   Note: this workshop is offered onsite only.           Sign up for Smart Classroom Hands-On: SMART Podium   Email: *     An e-mail address is required for users who are not registered at this site.
